column2: Roles and Responsibilities   1.  In charge of customs clearance , certificates verification & application, and updated clearance policy &requirements advocacy and training, to ensure equipment & raw and auxiliary materials & spare parts &semi-finished and finished goods & defective goods, and so on can be imported and exported smoothly. 2.  In charge of transportation,  to make sure equipment & raw and auxiliary materials  & spare parts & semi-finished and finished goods & defective goods, and so on can be delivered safely; 3.  In charge of tax exemption  goods application and management to make sure Tax exemption goods can be used legally 4. In charge of assessing the regular performance of and managing logistics and clearance vendors. 5. Responsible for purchasing  cargo transportation insurance  and dealing with cargo transportation insurance claim Desired Candidate Profile     1. Bachelor's degree or above, more than 7 years of working experience in customs declaration or logistics; 2. Obtain the "Customs Broker Qualification Certificate" or "Customs Level Certificate (Elementary) 4. Fluent in English 6. Learn about international trade practices, international freight practices, trade management measures, tax planning, and other knowledge; 7. Familiar with relevant laws and regulations such as import and export customs clearance, bonded processing and bonded logistics, commodity classification, customs enterprise credit management, and announcements and orders issued by the General Administration of Customs; 8. Good cargo classification, certificate identification, and communication and coordination skills; 9. Good execution ability and project management ability; Perks and Benefits

statutory audit requirements and ensure compliance Coordinating & following up with vendor for timely delivery of the raised Purchase Order (PO), Invoice & Packing List, and Shipping Instruction as per the norms Checking physical vs system stock on monthly basis, liquidation of non-moving material and performing incoming material check for invoice & physical quantity Liaising with transporters for deployment of suitable vehicle to optimize vehicle capacity, finalizing the logistics arrangements at an optimum cost with reliable transporter for non-std. movements Collaborating with Manufacturing and Marketing Team for timely dispatch of the Engines  Monitoring E-Way Bill generation after invoice preparation and transportation bills processing Improving logistic cost of project by appropriate sourcing strategies for various materials of the project Management of vendor relations, liaising vendor payables and delivery commitment Liaison between assembly units, vendors, marketing team and customers to achieve optimum delivery level Closely working with marketing team to ensure product availability on time Flexibility in availability of assembled engines to meet varied demand Studying plant wise stock availability and Organising Inter unit stock transfer BOM & Part number plant wise Material Master updating & A/C view updating & Extending in SAP  Price uploading for registering SO (Sales Order) in SAP Creating Sales Order, purchase Order and STO (Stock transfer Order) Preparing exports documentations (LC & Advance) Preparing the Pre-shipping documents to move the Cargo from plant(Factory) to Ports Co-Ordinate with Logistic Companies & Indian Customs for SB (Shipping Bill) filling Co-Ordinate with MCCI (Madras Chamber of Commerce & Industry) to arranging the Origin Certificate Dealing with ECGC (Export Credit Guarantee Corporation of India Ltd) and preparing GSP (Generalized System of Preferences) FORM A Certificate of Origin clearance of the shipments

column2: HITECH PRINT SYSTEMS LIMITED is looking for Trainee Supervisors to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      Training and Development: Participating in a training program that covers various aspects of supervision and management, including leadership skills, team dynamics, and company policies      Shadowing: Observing and learning from experienced supervisors or managers to understand their roles and responsibilities      Team Management: Assisting in supervising and leading teams of employees, including delegating tasks, providing guidance, and monitoring performance      Communication: Developing effective communication skills to interact with team members, colleagues, and higher-level management      Problem Solving: Learning how to identify and address operational issues, conflicts, and challenges that may arise within the team or department      Performance Evaluation: Participating in performance evaluations and feedback sessions for team members to provide input on their performance      Project Management: Assisting with the planning and execution of departmental projects or initiatives      Compliance and Policies: Understanding and ensuring that team members adhere to company policies, procedures, and safety regulations      Conflict Resolution: Learning how to resolve conflicts and disputes within the team or between team members      Report Preparation: Preparing reports on team performance, project status, or other relevant matters as required by higher-level management      Decision Making: Gaining experience in making decisions related to daily operations, resource allocation, and team management      Supervisory Skills: Developing the skills necessary to lead and motivate a team, provide direction, and achieve team goals
column11: Supervisor, Training, Team management, Compliance, Conflict resolution, Project management, Resource allocation, Operations, Monitoring, Supervision

column2: Supply Chain Strategy and Planning           :                       Develop and execute supply chain strategies aligned with business goals.                     Collaborate with the Supply Chain Network Design team to optimize transportation, inventory, and distribution processes.                     Create and implement demand forecasting models to ensure timely product availability.                             Master Data Management           :                       Maintain accurate and up-to-date master data, including customer master data, material master, and plant master data.                     Ensure data integrity and consistency across systems (e.g., SAP).                             Order Management           :                       Oversee end-to-end order processing, from order entry to fulfillment.                     Coordinate with sales teams, production, and logistics to meet customer requirements.                     Monitor order status, backorders, and delivery timelines.                             Shipment Management           :                       Optimize transportation routes and modes (road, air, sea) for cost efficiency.                     Collaborate with carriers and freight forwarders to ensure timely and secure shipments.                     Address any shipping delays or issues promptly.                             Network Design and Optimization           :                       Analyze supply chain network design to identify opportunities for improvement.                     Evaluate distribution centers, warehouses, and transit points.                     Implement changes to enhance efficiency and reduce lead times.                             Delivery and Customer Service           :                       Ensure on-time delivery to customers.                     Monitor delivery performance metrics (e.g., OTIF - On Time in Full).                     Address any delivery discrepancies or customer complaints.                             Analytical Skills           :                       Utilize tools such as      Power Query     , Excel, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to analyze supply chain data.                     Extract insights, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions.                             Process Improvement           :                       Continuously assess processes and recommend enhancements.                     Implement best practices for supply chain efficiency.                     Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive improvements.                                   Required Skills and Qualifications                                   Education     : Bachelor s degree in supply chain management, Logistics, or a related field.                         Experience     :                      3-5 years of experience in supply chain management, logistics, or a related role.                     Proficiency in SAP SD (Sales and Distribution) module.                     Familiarity with demand planning and forecasting.                             Communication and Leadership     :                      Excellent communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.                     Leadership qualities to guide and motivate team members.                             Problem-Solving     :                      Proven ability to identify issues, propose solutions, and drive implementation.                     Strong critical thinking skills.                             Software Proficiency     :                      Proficient in Microsoft Excel, ERP systems, and supply chain software.                     Knowledge of transportation management systems (TMS) is a plus.

(as per agreed SLAs)     Identify and promote opportunities to leverage best practices and global standards within GBSS. RESPONSIBILITIES         Driving Efficient Operations         Key Participant in Sales and Operation Planning to ensure that forecast, POs are shared on time to Third Party Manufacturers (TPM)     Responsible for On Time procurement of Finished Goods sourced from TPM     Work in co-ordination with CQA team to ensure compliance and timely release of Finished Goods     Work with Distribution planner to optimize the Primary Freight     Ensuring FG planning in line with market demands balancing Inventory both at TPM and stock in system     Efficient stake holder management and ability to drive CFT projects .         Supplier Relationship Management         Monitoring and driving Vendor performance Management through Vendor Score Card     Integral part of team for finalizing TPM sites for New Products     Ensure Half Yearly Business Reviews (HBR) with TPMs to drive strategic initiatives     Developing network of Tier-2 Suppliers for Key APIs, PM to support TPM, work actively with them to drive cost efficiencies     Responsible for Imports of finished goods, opening L/C and co-ordination with CHA for timely clearances         Budgeting and Cost Efficiencies         Responsible for ensuring that Budgeted projections are met with favorable price variance     Responsible for closing procurement price with TPM, key API manufacturers and Packaging Materials     Responsible for market intelligence, getting key trends of commodities and developing efficient balance between short term/long term contracts     Responsible for driving Operational Excellence of cost/process improvement in TPM sites     Statutory and Internal Compliances     Responsible for ensuring valid agreements with TPM     Ensuring compliance to statutory taxations, Road Permit requirements and timely closure of audit findings     Ensuring on time closure of CAPA, Deviations raised by CQA     Responsible for compliance to PEL procurement policies     Ensuring On time payment to TPM by coordinating with key stake holders         QUALIFICATIONS         Engineering, B. Pharm, B.Sc. BMS, B Com Degree + 3 to 5 Years of Relevant Work Experience. column2: Performs physical loading, unloading of trucks containers, sorting of documents and ensuring its timely completion.         Sorts loads documents boxes in a logical flow to support optimal productivity on the delivery route.         Plans the route, re-prioritizes stops, to effectively complete pick-ups within Customer time-window and to meet defined productivity targets.         Highlights any difference to the agreed stop count and pro-actively seeks to balance routes with the pickup coordinator.         Performs defined pre post trip vehicle checks and also prepares the vehicle inspection report.         Adhere to state, and local warehousing, material handling, and shipping requirements by studying existing and new legislation.         Ensures the accuracy timely completion of necessary documents (delivery records, pick-up manifests, time-cards etc) audits customer documents (AWB, customs paperwork, commercial invoice etc) as well. column2: Financial Planning and Analysis: You will be involved in the development of financial plans, budgets, and forecasts     This includes analyzing historical data, identifying trends, and making projections for future financial performance     Financial Reporting: You will prepare financial statements, including balance sheets, income statements, and cash flow statements     These reports provide crucial information to stakeholders, such as management, investors, and regulatory authorities     Budgeting and Cost Control: You will participate in the budgeting process, working closely with department heads to allocate resources efficiently     Additionally, you will monitor and control expenses to ensure they align with the approved budget     Financial Risk Management: You will assess financial risks, such as market volatility, credit risks, and liquidity risks, and develop strategies to mitigate them     This involves monitoring financial markets, staying updated on regulatory changes, and implementing appropriate risk management techniques     Cash Flow Management: You will manage the organization's cash flow, ensuring that it has sufficient liquidity to meet its financial obligations     This includes monitoring cash inflows and outflows, optimizing working capital, and implementing cash management strategies     Financial Compliance: You will ensure compliance with financial regulations, accounting standards, and internal policies     This involves staying updated on relevant laws and regulations, conducting internal audits, and implementing internal controls to prevent fraud and ensure accuracy of financial reporting     Financial Strategy and Decision Support: You will provide financial insights and recommendations to support strategic decision-making     This may involve evaluating investment opportunities, assessing the financial impact of business initiatives, and conducting financial feasibility studies

JOB   SCOPE/DIMENSIONS Markets: Refractory,Abrasives,Construction Country: India (position) Domestic (scope)  KEY   TASKS   AND   RESPONSIBILITIES Order fulfilment processing (domestics outbound order, export outbound order, direct plant import order)  Receive customer purchase order, verify and input in ERP / CRM system.  Coordinate with related internal department, warehouse and transport suppliers to arrange suitable delivery solutions to the customer in accordance with the committed delivery date.  Prepare, verify the shipping documents and share with the customer as per required timeline.  Process all the required operational and system related transactions in accordance with standard operating  guidelines.  Monitor order credit block as well as order blockage and process milestones during order fulfilment cycle and to ensure all relevant parties are made aware of potential problems / delay if any. Customer service  Assist all customers enquiries and feedbacks related to orders.  Establish and maintain good working relationships with customers.  Lead the collaboration with the 3rd party service providers and internal parties to ensure smooth and on time  delivery. column2: Role & responsibilities   Inventory Management: Monitor inventory levels and ensure stock availability to meet customer demand. Implement inventory control measures to minimize stockouts and overstock situations. Coordinate with procurement teams to maintain accurate inventory records. Transportation Management: Arrange transportation for incoming and outgoing goods, considering cost, speed, and reliability. Liaise with carriers, freight forwarders to negotiate rates and terms. Ensure timely delivery of goods to designated locations. Distribution: Plan and optimize distribution routes to minimize transportation costs and delivery times. Coordinate with warehouse and distribution center staff to ensure efficient loading and unloading of goods. Oversee the distribution process to ensure accurate and timely delivery of products to customers. Documentation and Compliance: Prepare documents, including bills of lading Ensure compliance with local regulations governing transportation and trade. Maintain records of all logistics activities and documentation for audit purposes. Supplier and Vendor Management: Build and maintain relationships with suppliers, carriers, and logistics service providers. Evaluate supplier performance and negotiate contracts to optimize service levels and costs. Resolve any issues or disputes with suppliers and vendors in a timely manner. Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline logistics processes and improve efficiency. Implement best practices and new technologies to enhance logistics operations. Analyze logistics data to identify trends and areas for improvement. Preferred candidate profile   Bachelors degree in logistics, supply chain management, business administration, or a related field. Proven experience in logistics operations Strong knowledge of logistics processes, transportation modes, and supply chain management principles. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Experience - 4-5 years of Logistics Experience Industry:  FMCG/Healthcare Business  Education: Commerce Background   Job Description:  Functional Competencies: Oversees all aspects of export logistics, including coordinating shipments, managing documentation, and ensuring compliance with international regulations. Develops and implements strategies to optimize export processes, minimize costs, and improve efficiency. Liaises with freight forwarders, carriers, customs agents, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth transportation of goods. Manages export documentation, including preparing invoices, packing lists, certificates of origin, and other required paperwork. Ensures compliance with export regulations and trade compliance laws, including export controls, sanctions, and customs requirements. Monitors shipment status, resolves any issues or delays, and communicates updates to relevant parties. Manages relationships with suppliers, vendors, and service providers to negotiate favorable terms and ensure timely delivery of goods. Analyzes logistics data and key performance indicators to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions. Provides guidance and support to team members, ensuring proper training and development to maintain high standards of performance. Collaborates with internal departments, such as sales, procurement, and finance, to coordinate export activities and achieve business objectives.   Behavioral Competencies: Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively interact with internal and external stakeholders. Attention to detail and accuracy in handling documentation and compliance requirements. Problem-solving skills with the ability to quickly identify issues and implement solutions. Leadership abilities with a focus on fostering teamwork, motivation, and accountability within the export logistics team. Adaptability and flexibility to navigate changing regulations, market conditions, and operational requirements. Integrity and ethics in dealing with sensitive information and complying with legal and ethical standards. Customer-oriented mindset with a commitment to delivering high-quality service and exceeding customer expectations. Analytical thinking with the ability to interpret data, identify trends, and make informed decisions to drive continuous improvement. Proactive approach to anticipating challenges and taking preemptive action to mitigate risks and ensure operational success.

column1: Engineering Services Associate - Supply chain engineering service
column2: Skill required:Supply chain engineering service - Electrical Engineering  Designation:Engineering Services Associate  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Supply Chain and Operations vertical and help us in the system of organizations, people, activities, information, and resources involved in moving a product or service from supplier to customer. The Supply chain engineering service team will be involved in ensuring that the equipment attributes are updated and attached to a maintenance plan This role requires a thorough understanding of the electrical power network & distribution, should have a good command of Electrical power principles, alternating current/direct current theories, dynamic/static engineering systems, application of electrical and electronic circuit theory. The team will work on data models for the distribution of electrical energy - Transmission grid/ local grid/substations, they help in the implementation of power system models for stationary calculation methods such as load flow, short circuit, as well as dynamic and electromagnetic simulation. They are also responsible for providing insights for improving the networking of power distribution for effective power distribution. They work on power flow modeling & transmission modeling, load flow simulation studies, voltage regulation study. They work on international codes, standards, and recommended practices standards like ANSI, IEEE, NEC, ISA, NEMA.  What are we looking for? Ability to perform under pressure  Results orientation  Ability to manage multiple stakeholders Roles and Responsibilities:  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor  In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks  The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

environment, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity        Responsibilities:        Procurement:Source and evaluate suppliers, negotiate contracts, and manage supplier relationships optimize transportation, distribution, and delivery processes      Monitor and track shipments to ensure on-time delivery and address any issues      Work with logistics partners to improve efficiency and reduce costs      Inventory Management:Oversee inventory levels and ensure optimal stock levels to meet demand      Implement inventory control measures to minimize stockouts and overstock cost reduction      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement improvements in supply chain processes

column2: Role & responsibilities:  Closely work with marketing team and other functions for planning & managing the outbound logistic activities required for execution of sales orders and timely delivery of material to customers. Manage logistic activities including transport planning, product dispatch plan and activities, prepare required documentation w.r.t outbound movement of goods. Keep inventory records and manage movement of stock based on sales forecast, coordination with warehouse & logistic service providers to ensure fulfilment of customer orders.  Managing daily transportation & Dispatch from plant including vehicle planning, indent processing, Business allocation, managing secondary transportation from depot. Liaison with transporters, insurance company and other departments within the organization for settlement of insurance claims whenever required. Supporting the sales team by timely execution & accurate delivery of orders and monitor day to day stock situation at Plant & in depot. Prepare MIS reports as required. Prepare documents and records for timely settlement of transportation bills and other logistic costs and work with marketing team and other functions to optimize cost of operations. Ensure all transporters and warehousing activities follow Safety norms and adhere to the Standard Operating Processes (SOPs) defined by the organization.  Must have understanding and experience of preparing and monitoring the QMS i.e. ISO 9001, ISO 14000, ISO 45000 & IATF: 16949 documentation and audits by internal and external auditors.  Preferred candidate profile     Graduation in any discipline having 5 years of experience in Warehousing & Logistics with reputed organization.  Candidate must possess good skills to manage and supervise various activities on the shop floor and communicate well with contract labour and transporters, drivers etc.  Good skills on MS Excel, Word and required working knowledge of SAP  SD and MM Module is must for this position.  Candidates having work experience with companies engaged in marketing of products especially petrochemicals, both in domestic and overseas markets and handling large volume movement of cargo by road, rail and sea would be given preference.

column2: The logistics executive job description entails developing integrated logistics management systems, collaborating with other departments, including sales, marketing, and order management; accounting and shipping. It also involves performing analysis of the overall budget/expenses for the logistics operations of the organization and determining the most cost-effective and efficient means of transportation services. Logistics executives are also responsible for the direct day-to-day operations to ensure achievement of cost, productivity, or accuracy, or timeliness objectives of the department, as well as manage logistics personnel and systems. They work together with logistics planners to forecast demand in their markets and build logistics plans to guarantee availability of products or services, and streamline processes and flow of goods from point of order to delivery.

column2: 1. Inventory Management: Monitor and maintain accurate inventory levels through regular stock checks, reconciliations, and audits.     2. Stock Organization: Implement effective storage solutions to optimize space utilization and facilitate easy access to items.     3. Stock Replenishment: Coordinate with relevant departments to ensure timely replenishment of stock to meet operational demands.     4. Quality Control: Conduct regular quality checks on incoming and outgoing stock to ensure adherence to standards and specifications.     5. Stock Movement: Coordinate the movement of stock within the warehouse or between locations, ensuring proper handling and documentation.     6. Vendor Management: Liaise with suppliers and vendors to track deliveries, resolve discrepancies, and maintain positive relationships.     7. Reporting: Generate regular reports on stock levels, movements, and discrepancies for management review and decision-making.     8. Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to streamline stock management processes and implement efficiency-enhancing measures.     9. Compliance: Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements related to stock management and inventory control.       Requirements:       1. Knowledge: Strong understanding of stock management principles, inventory control techniques, and warehouse operations.     2. Attention to Detail: Ability to maintain high levels of accuracy in inventory tracking and stock documentation.     3. Organizational Skills: Excellent organizational and prioritization skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.     4. Communication: Effective verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to interact professionally with colleagues, suppliers, and other stakeholders.     5. Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to identify issues, analyze root causes, and implement effective solutions.     6. Computer Literacy: Proficiency in MS Office applications and inventory management software.     7. Physical Stamina: Ability to perform tasks that may involve lifting, carrying, and moving heavy items.     8. Team Player: Collaborative attitude with the ability to work effectively as part of a team.

column2: The Logistics Executive is responsible for overseeing and coordinating the transportation, storage, and distribution of goods and materials within the organization     They will work closely with various internal departments and external partners to ensure the timely and cost-effective delivery of products while maintaining high-quality standards       Key Responsibilities:       Supply Chain Management:Coordinate and manage the entire supply chain process from procurement to distribution     Monitor and optimize inventory levels to meet customer demands while minimizing carrying costs     Transportation Management:Arrange transportation for inbound and outbound shipments, including negotiating contracts with carriers and freight forwarders     Track and manage shipment schedules to ensure on-time deliveries     Warehouse Management:Oversee warehouse operations, including receiving, storage, and order fulfillment     Ensure efficient utilization of warehouse space and resources     Inventory Control:Implement inventory control procedures to minimize stockouts, overstocking, and obsolescence     Conduct regular stock audits and reconcile discrepancies     Vendor Management:Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and logistics service providers     Evaluate supplier performance and negotiate favorable terms and conditions     Documentation and Compliance:Prepare and maintain accurate shipping and import/export documentation     Ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations related to logistics and transportation     Cost Management:Identify cost-saving opportunities in logistics operations and implement cost-effective solutions     Monitor and control logistics-related expenses within the budget     Risk Management:Identify potential risks in the supply chain and develop contingency plans     Implement measures to mitigate risks related to transportation and inventory management

column2: PL responsibility - Will be responsible for liaising with commercial team, cost managers and country management to win new customers and maintain relationship with existing customers such that the revenue budget targets are achieved.                  Control costs / EBITDA targets - Will be responsible to continuously track overheads and cost of sales to ensure that the Overhead and EBITDA budget targets for the location is achieved.                  Responsible to ensure smooth operation of jobs handled by the location team. Ensure that all KPIs like QQ score, updating information in operational IT platform like OneDA/Optic etc are maintained.                  Responsible to follow process laid down in ISS policies and procedures including compliance checks on vessel / principal, prefunding requirements, operational requirements including maintaining hard and soft copy of vessel related documents and information etc. Will be responsible to ensure smooth conduct of audit for the location and retention/maintenance of documents as required basis.                  Overall responsibility for keeping track of performance of vendors and sub agents operating in her / his location. Carry out vendor management activities in consultation with Strategic sourcing team and as laid down in vendor management manual/policies and procedures.                  Coordination of all vessel s operation crew logistics at port. Assist where necessary with Hapag Lloyd liner husbandry functions.                  Prepare per job SDS sheet, weekly revenue sheet and monthly PL statement for locations managed by her /his team.                  Ensure that her/his team creates appointment in oneDA prior vessel arrival, create service order correctly in OneDA, update information in Optic/Maersk application on timely manner. If applicable, also responsible to chase vendors for invoices, uploads vendor invoices in OneDA in timely manner in order to ensure that the DA TAT does not exceed 19 days.                  Supervision and guidance of junior staff and training them in the Inchcape way. Ensure that her / his team carries out the mandatory trainings in LMS on timely manner. If there is any requirement for vendor training then liaise with LMS/ISS QHSSE team to get training done for vendor staff in timely manner as per the relevant guidelines.                  Ensuring all QMS QHSSE standards are being followed in the execution of all operational activities. Responsible to track and close OPEN CARs in SALESFORCE. Attend QHSSE Coordination Committee meetings and contribute significantly.                  Develop and maintain a good relationship with Senior Port / Customs / Immigration Officials.      s and Responsibilities:                              Co-ordination, Supervision and Monitoring:                    Supervision and monitoring all Operation and Documentation activities on day to day basis and to ensure all processes are carried out in a timely and professional manner based on the Company s objectives, overseeing all documentations and assignments and to ensure appropriate documentations / clearances are done.                    Formulate local guidelines to implement right shipping practices procedures for the team and align local SOP with ISS policies and procedures.                  Ensure compliance to customs regulation tariff for import / export and marine/cruise statutory tariff.                  Oversee submission of shipping documents to port customs, payment of Light dues.                  Ensure location team s adherence to principal s procedure.                  Follow-up for invoices from Port and local vendors so as to avoid delays in closing appointment.                  Check Invoices received / log and update OneDA system and upload                  Monitor activities and make changes where necessary which will add value.                  Evaluate information /results and choose the best solution to solve problems.                  Monitor sub agent s and vendor s performance                              Marine Operations:                              Discuss important matters that come up in berthing meetings with Port staff.                  Oversee declaration of all vessels and advance planning for berthing and requested service.                  Oversee communications with all concerned parties, including Terminal/ Shippers and Receivers.                  Oversee communications with Master/ Principals on Pre- arrival requirements                  Vessel inward outward clearance oversight.                  Oversee crew logistics arrangements and take corrective actions where necessary.                  Oversee vessel requirements, delivery of spares, repairs, supply, medical assistance, survey                  Supervising vessel operations and providing additional support to the team as needed.                  Oversee and ensure that Vessel /owners updated on local procedures prior arrival.                  Coordinating with the principles for DA Queries and with GDC/Billing team when required.                  Keeping self-abreast of all local and central procedures and developments.                  Ensuring prefund against PDA prior vessel arrival for SPOT calls and from HUB customers/principals as and when required.                  Emails to be responded within 30 minutes of receipt. Each location must provide Market intelligence report, Vessel line up, for Clipper data, LNG, Fertilizer Sugar, Cruise updates in India and any report being requested by Commercial /Intelligence team. Target 100% adherence.                  Location must be 100% QHSSE compliant and ready at any given time. All CAR s (audit / customer escalations, including old open CAR and OFI s) needs to be closed within 10 days of CAR being raised. Maintain performance dash boards for your coast locations.                  All appointments (including CLS HUB) opened in OneDA Optic must be updated by team with ATA and Vessel E-Mail within 24hrs of berthing. Subsequently ATS to be updated. This is to be enforced strictly and oversight maintained by you.                  ATA /ATS Vessel Email Address to be updated in OneDA application within 24hrs of berthing.                  Oversight on obtaining Income Tax Clearances/ filing returns for Marine.                  Complete Freight tax documentation jobs know how until Final tax payment.                  All advance fund request for port charges or vendors should indicate the estimated revenue to be generated. This role is to ensure these are done properly and reflect the correct line items.                  Oversight that all appointments to be closed to CE with 48 hours of ATS, and DA to be closed within 20 days of ATS. Follow-up for outstanding for locations.                  Oversee that Trade notices / Circulars Tariff changes from Port, Customs, DG Shipping, Immigration must be stored on the location common drive and on Location Q-share point. Escalate any matters of concern to the Country Manager.                          Who you are:            5+ years of experience in Port operations, Marine and Ship Ops.                          Effective team player experienced in facilitating collaboration and change.                          Proven ability to manage vessel full calls in port applied effectively and the ability to achieve seamless operational success.

column2: Transportation Management: Executives in Logistics manage the transportation of goods, including scheduling shipments, coordinating with carriers, and monitoring delivery times.     Inventory Management: Executives in Logistics manage inventory levels, including determining optimal stock levels, monitoring inventory levels, and forecasting future inventory needs.     Warehousing: Executives in Logistics manage warehouse operations, including storage, distribution, and order fulfillment.     Cost Management: Executives in Logistics manage logistics costs, including transportation, warehousing, and inventory costs, and identify cost-saving opportunities.     Reporting: Executives in Logistics prepare reports related to logistics operations, including transportation performance, inventory levels, and logistics costs.

column2: This position is responsible for driving Imports procurement processes to ensure timely availability of product to meet the customer demand & organization plan of revenue, freight, and inventory. The position will be responsible to efficiently manage the on-time delivery leading indicators such as Supplier On-time delivery, On-time arrival, by working in close partnership with various partners such as Supplier, Freight Forwarder, Customs agents, Sales, Customer Service & Warehouse. The position will also provide real time visibility and analytical support to aide quick decision making to achieve the goal of customer satisfaction & business profitability.               Primary Responsibilities:           Execute import procurement strategies to ensure timely and cost-effective sourcing of goods.     Monitor supplier performance, resolve issues, and maintain strong relationships to ensure continuity of the supply chain.     Stay updated with import regulations, tariffs, duties, and trade agreements to ensure compliance and minimize risks.     Collaborate with internal stakeholders such as Supplier, Freight forwarder, Customs agents, logistics, Customer service and finance to optimize procurement processes and meet business objectives.     Manage import documentation, including customs clearance, shipping documents, and permits, to facilitate smooth import operations.     Maintain record of all key communications including but not limited to customs to help future audit queries.     Maintain updated copies of Rate contract / pricing agreement with Supplier, Freight forwarders, Customs agents for ready reference from time to time.     Help maintain & analyse procurement data, track key performance indicators, and prepare reports to assess performance and identify areas for improvement.     Stay abreast of industry best practices, technological advancements, and innovations in import procurement.     Timely ordering of material requirements as per demand / forecast to meet revenue & On-time delivery targets.     Facilitate Daily Management activities related to Imports procurement.     Address supply chain issues by communicating, escalating, and coordinating with various stakeholders for resolution.     Submit regular & periodic update to the supply chain leadership team.     Work with multiple vendors to determine the best deals for the company and evaluate pros and cons of each, based on price, quality, speed of delivery and other factors.     Should be able to gather information to aid quick decision making.     Demonstrate Basic math skills to analyse prices and get the best deals possible.     Use good Negotiation skills to work with suppliers to create the best deals.             Knowledge, Skills          Education - Bachelor s degree/ Management diploma / degree in Supply chain / Operations / Logistics is an added advantage.     Work experience - Minimum of 3-5 years of supply chain / logistics in an Indian or a multi-national company.     Excellent competency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint     Excellent negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills     Must have good communication skills & proficiency in English, Hindi     Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.     Attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills.     Certification in procurement or supply chain management is a plus.

column2: Family Description       Supply (SU) covers the configuration, demand, and supply planning, order management, sourcing, production, delivery, and managing the procurement activities towards our suppliers.       Subfamily Description       Supply Operations (SOP) comprises the customer facing part of the supply chain. Covers the execution process after order intake as receiving and validating customer purchase order, equipment & service order management, procurement, delivery execution, and invoicing for the customer teams in the markets. Furthermore, SOP contains the management of local distribution and local material availability, and the contribution of pre-sales by providing optimised supply chain solution design and cost baseline.           Impact       Impact is short-term and departmental/project in scope. Accountable for quality, accuracy and efficiency. Actions and errors can have functional area impact.        Scope & Contribution       Individual Contributor: Variety of complex tasks within area of responsibility, Demonstrates initiative & contributes to problem solving. Acts with independence and discretion in routine matters. Makes decisions that affect own work. Managerial/Supervisory: May act as Team Leader or Project Leader with some direct supervisory responsibilities in addition to own work assignments. Variety of complex tasks within area of responsibility. Acts with independence and discretion in routine matters. Makes decisions that affect own work.       Innovation       Performs routine activites to meet departmental/project objectives. Requires moderate supervision. Applies commonly recognised concepts within their field of expertise. Shares knowledge with less experienced peers or have high collegial interaction. Raises innovative ideas. Demonstrates adaptability to changing business environments. Is willing to take on new roles or jobs appropriate to skill set in different environments and/or locations.        Communication       Works to influence others to accept job functions view/practices and agree/accept new concepts, practices, and approaches. May conduct briefings with senior leaders within the job function. May at times be required to negotiate regarding operational issues. Has cross-cultural knowledge and global mindset       Knowledge & Experience       Established skills and knowledge of theory and principles within a professional discipline. Uses functionally specific knowledge. Typically 3-5 years directly related experience and a graduate equivalent degree.             Please note hiring for this position is only for JG7 or below.             Responsibilities :-         Coordinates and validates the customer order intake.     Manages ordering of most products (HW, SW, Services) in most business scenarios, including customer cases and Nokia risk orders, trials, demonstration, R&D, free of charge processes.     Triggers task creations for transactions (EG purchase orders, sales orders, delivery notes, invoices, letter of credit to Business Process Owner (BPO) order management operations and monitors timely completion).     Coordinates export, import and customs processes till goods receipt in drop of point.     Coordinates the procurement execution: Captures the demand, purchase, goods receipt and verifies invoice.     Coordinates the distribution execution: Plans transportation, verifies freight cost and invoice, coordinates transport.     Coordinates and validates the customer invoice.     Contributes and supports the collect cash process, including documentary remittances (EG letter of credit) and dispute solving with customer.     Guides and provides technical expertise where applicable.     Provides working leadership and training to less experienced personnel.     May lead small projects with limited risks and resource requirements.
column11: Procurement, BPO, Supply chain, Business process, Order management, Operations management, Sales, Export import, Presales, Operations

column2: Serves as the primary point of contact for Field Operations personnel and as a liaison between or among customers, Field Operations and internal business groups      Coordinates and monitors customer appointments to ensure timely and excellent customer experience      Monitors technical status to manage arrival times and shift completion      Monitors job pools and schedules, identifying unfilled time slots, overbooking, inefficiencies, cancellations and other situations including effective route control, appointment arrangements with customers / providers, Spare parts management, debriefing quality analysis and documentation      Dispatching of all assigned work within the assigned territory to field service technicians and third parties      Ensure SLAs and balance workload between applicable resources and considering egskills and spare parts availability in a most cost effective and efficient manner      Takes action to assign or reassign work to meet customer commitments                Required Qualifications      Education or equivalent work experience required.      Minimum of 4-6 years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience in Field Service Dispatch.      Good local language skills required (Written and spoken) and preferably good business English skills (Written and spoken).      Performs all duties of a Dispatcher / Senior Dispatcher, plus: Receives and coordinates same day (must do) and future appointment requests.      Assesses the urgency of customer service needs and addresses / escalates, as appropriate.      Interacts with Field Service technicians and/or supervisor to resolve missed appointments and go back requests.      Audits incomplete past due work orders and follows up to ensure that work orders are resolved and closed within guidelines.      Uses error reporting mechanisms to provide supervisor with feedback on work order accuracy.      Notifies Technicians of specific issues related to systems outages or problems that may impact day-to-day assignment completion.      Identifies and communicates potential issues to Technicians to ensure their safety in various conditions / situations.      Communicates and collaborates with internal partners to solve problems and ensure customers needs are met.      Documents actions taken on each call, applying credit adjustments (due to failure to meet on-time guarantee, trouble call charges) and balances accounts.

column2: ?       Perform a variety of duties ensuring orderly and timely delivery of materials from vendors and supplying the same to the other departments.     Responsible for taking the necessary action for the purchase requests received from the stores and user departments.     To coordinate all the functions of the team within the department.     To maintain records and files related to purchasing activities.     Any matter which may effect the interests of    ACCOR    should be brought to the attention of the Management.         Key Responsibilities:         People Management          Motivate and develop the team to ensure smooth functioning of the department and promote teamwork.     Provide effective support to the team to enable them to provide a range of effective and efficient services.         Financial Management          Identify optimal, cost effective use of the resources and educate the team on the same.         Operational Management          Receive, examine and process departmental requisitions.     Review and verify orders submitted by requisitioning departments.         Receive and action requisition from stores and user departments.     Counter check whether items indented are contracted or non-contracted and prepare purchase order accordingly.     Ensure that the purchase order meets the criteria of quality, price, timeliness and reliability and also the standards of the company.     Compare costs and evaluate the quality and suitability of supplies, materials and equipment.     Ensure that a copy of purchase order is sent to all the concerned departments.     Follow up with suppliers for efficient service and in case of late delivery of the materials ordered.     Ensure closure of purchase record after delivery of items.     Ensure to assist the Purchasing Assistant in all aspects of the job.     Ensure to monitor & handle dispatches to other departments as required.     Handle additional responsibilities as and when delegated by top management.     Coordinate operations with Department Coordinators, Supervisors and other Departmental Managers to ensure operational readiness, efficiency in resource utilization and the prompt delivery of services.         Qualifications         About you:       To be successful in the role, the candidate brings along the following experiences and competencies:        Person should have completed any relevant graduation      1 to 2 years working experience. or related actuarial experience.     Strong communication skills and proficiency English.     High motivativation, team-orientation and adaptability.     Strong IT and data management skills.     Strong knowledge of Property & Casualty lines of business     Strong ability to work remotely with team members and across departments across multiple time zones.

They help provide support, management, & supplier training during the supplier vetting process as new suppliers join programs. They help manage & document supplier performance, including program suspension and/or removal if expected results are not achieved. What are we looking for? column2: Job Purpose: To provide an enhanced level of customer services and operational support. Customer Services agent will deal with shipment specific and other service-related issues. Main Duties and Responsibilities: To monitor all shipments on a daily basis to ensure that shipments are collected and delivered within agreed time frames. Working with customers, internal & external, on daily basis with the aim of developing an excellent working relationship. Working with patients to ensure that collection requirements are met and that they are kept informed at all times during the process to ensure visibility. Booking and processing booking requests within Markens internal database, generating and verifying shipping documentation where applicable. Liaise with all relevant departments within the Global and Domestic Marken network to ensure that all customer requirements are met. Working all Marken offices and Local Service Providers to ensure the logistics transfer is handled efficiently thus meeting desired turnaround times. Entering clinical trial sites into Marken?? internal database (where necessary). Answering and dealing with general telephone and e-mail requests from external customers and internal offices/agents. Preparing, verifying and distributing country specific project documentation. Filing and archiving where required. Attending customer meetings and teleconferences, when required. Requirements: Skilled in use of Microsoft Suite (Excel, Word and Outlook) Knowledgeable with computers Thorough understanding of Aviation/Airline networks Excellent communication skills and ability to influence others Excellent problem solving and prioritization skills essential Flexibility in working hours required. Weekend coverage required in Customer Services in some cases Marken  is a wholly owned subsidiary of UPS and is a critical part of UPS Healthcare. Marken offers a state-of-the-art GMP-compliant depot network and logistic hubs for clinical drug product storage and distribution worldwide, and supports cell and gene therapy logistics services from clinical to commercial, while maintaining the leading position for Direct-to-Patient and Home Healthcare services, biological sample shipments and biological kit production. Moving Our World Forward by Delivering What Matters.

column2: Role & responsibilities: 1) Processing the ROGs (Receipt of goods) for the product received at various warehouses.  2) Coordinate with all the branch warehouse/showrooms to plan the inventory for stock       purposes as per the business requirement and forecast.  3) Plan and schedule truck between the Hub to Hub and Hub to spoke warehouses.  4) Coordinate with the trucking companies as and when required to facilitate transfers and plan      the routing for drop shipments. 5) Ensure that there arent open transfers over 10 days pending for movement.  6) Serve as liaison with third-party delivery service to coordinate deliveries and resolve problems. 7) Provide information and assistance as needed to inventory and warehouse personnel to allow       for expeditious processing of damaged and defective merchandise.  8) Perform additional duties as required and/or requested . Preferred candidate profile:  1) Should be a Graduate or above with about 1- 4 years of experience in a QA/QC for any        transaction based process, specialization in the Order Management is preferred.  2) The Candidate should have an ability to multi-task, prioritize and be open to learning new        tasks.  3) The candidate must be good with numbers and should know MS-Excel usage with standard       use of excel functionality. 4) The Candidate should be a quick learner and must be able to switch between tasks.  5) The incumbent must have a logical approach must be curious by nature.  6) The Candidate should have the ability to focus on the business policies with attention to detail       and quality of service.  7) The candidate must have excellent PC skills with a decent typing speed and should be well       versed with MS Outlook.  8) Must be flexible with night shift and be prepared to take ownership of the task assigned with       minimal supervision.

column2: ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Processing sales orders for the company's sales divisions. Developing documentation related to support. Planning inventory control. Arranging distribution of products. Solving problems in cases of product returns. Placing orders, processing return requests, and entering credits. Handling customer inquiries regarding product information, ordering procedures, special orders, pricing, quotes, problems, returns, and shipping. Communicating with customers about order status, any delays, or problems with their requests. Serving as a liaison with third-party delivery services to coordinate deliveries and resolve problems. Providing information and assistance as needed to inventory and warehouse personnel to expedite processing of damaged and defective merchandise. Performing additional duties as required or requested. Desired Candidate Profile The candidate should possess minimum of 1 - 3 years of experience in an international process specialization in Order Management is preferred. Should be a fast learner. The candidate should possess relationship management skills since the job will involve liaising with customers and US stakeholders. The candidate should have the ability to multitask, prioritize, learn more, and be flexible. Must have excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal & written) skills with all levels of employees and management. Should have excellent PC skills and be well-versed with Microsoft Products like Excel, Word, and Access (optional). Goal-oriented, motivated self-starter, with excellent organizational skills and strong problem-solving skills. Good follow-up skills and strong attention to detail. Ability to work effectively with other organizations and individuals at all levels with minimal supervision and assume accountability for issues until final resolution. Flexible to night shifts is mandatory (9:00 pm to 6:00 am).

column2: Logistics Management:         Identifying, networking, develop key logistics companies /stakeholders to move material to and from in the supply chain across India         Work closely with different verticals to ensure on-time movement of material to client / vendor locations based on pre-approved shipping schedules         Work with logistic companies, freight forwarders and liners to establish least time and cost factors to help with export of material from site locations         Track consignments and update internal teams as and when needed           Continuous Improvement:           Identify opportunities to improve loading and unloading time at site locations by deploying innovative strategies working closely with site teams         Identify and sign long-term MOUs with logistics companies involving export freight         Identify areas to improve efficiency, and safety and bring down costs per kg of material moved         Deploy appropriate material handling equipment like ramps, conveyors, and forklifts at the site locations           Reporting and Documentation:           Maintain various due-diligence and other required documentation at vendor level, managing, monitoring and reviewing it periodically.         Ensure timely, concise and accurate reports on a daily, weekly and monthly basis on prescribed formats for all material handled as logistics.         Ensure timely, concise and accurate CRM updates like shipment tracker, schedule tracker, payment tracker etc.         Manage and maintain end to end documentation of export shipment and inland shipments         Help managers and teams to capture information from the field as and when required.           General responsibilities:           Ensure professionalism at all times and demonstrate exemplary prioritization of workload skills.         Ensure that the PFC policies, SOPs and protocols are being adhered to at all levels of the company.         Ensure strict adherence to data confidentiality and security.         Willingness to travel frequently across PFC site locations, sometimes at short notice, including other places as per need of project or the company.         Work closely with the PFC team and Partners.         Note: The roles and responsibilities outlined above are not meant to be an exhaustive list of tasks. Flexibility is required and the incumbent is expected to carry out any other related duties that are necessary for the optimum functioning of the company as a whole within the employee's skills and abilities whenever a need is pointed out, becomes apparent or as reasonably instructed.          KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS       Any graduate with a minimum of 4 years of experience in the logistics field.         Good understanding of logistics operations         Experience working in a logistics firm would be an added advantage.         Fluency in Kannada / Tamil, Hindi and English.           Does that sound like you            Good interpersonal skills and ability to work in the field alone.         Open to new challenges.         Good data management, documentation, and reporting skills.         Good computer skills MS Office and Working on CRM.         Ability to work under pressure and prioritize tasks.         Eye for detail.         Able to learn new systems, methods, processes and procedures.         Able to meet deadlines and produce quality outputs.         Proactive and self-motivated.         Humility, honesty, transparency, integrity and ability to maintain confidentiality

column2: The Supply Chain Associate will play a key role in optimizing our supply chain processes to ensure efficient procurement, production, and delivery of materials. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a proactive approach to problem-solving. This position requires collaboration with internal teams and external vendors to maintain seamless operations and meet customer demands.           ?         Responsibilities               Procurement:       Source and procure raw materials, packaging supplies, and equipment needed for production.     Negotiate contracts with suppliers to obtain favorable terms and pricing.           Inventory Management:       Monitor inventory levels and ensure adequate stock of materials to support production schedules.     Implement inventory control measures to minimize waste and optimize storage space.           Logistics Coordination:       Coordinate logistics for inbound and outbound shipments, including transportation and customs clearance.     Track and manage shipments to ensure timely delivery and minimize delays.           Supplier Relationship Management:       Build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and vendors.     Address any issues or discrepancies in deliveries, quality, or pricing.           Process Improvement:       Identify opportunities for process optimization and cost savings within the supply chain.     Implement continuous improvement initiatives to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.                     Qualifications             Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field.     2+ years of experience in supply chain, procurement, or logistics roles.     Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and ERP systems (eg, SAP, Oracle).     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Excellent communication and negotiation abilities.     Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.           ?

Job Summary: The Senior Executive Sales - Freight Forwarding / Domestic Logistics will be responsible for driving sales and revenue growth within the freight forwarding and domestic logistics sector. This role involves identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, maintaining relationships with existing clients, and providing tailored logistics solutions to meet customer needs. The Senior Executive will also work closely with the operations and logistics teams to ensure seamless service delivery and customer satisfaction. Key Responsibilities: Sales and Business Development: Identify and target potential clients within the freight forwarding and domestic logistics market. Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve sales targets and revenue goals. Generate leads through various channels, including networking, cold calling, and attending industry events. Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations and proposals to prospective clients. Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with existing clients to ensure repeat business and customer loyalty. Understand client needs and provide customized logistics solutions to meet their requirements. Conduct regular client meetings to review service performance and address any issues or concerns. Market Research and Analysis: Stay updated on industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities. Conduct market research to identify new business opportunities and potential clients. Analyze sales data and performance metrics to inform sales strategies and decision-making. Collaboration with Operations: Work closely with the operations and logistics teams to ensure smooth service delivery. Coordinate with internal departments to address client requirements and resolve any service-related issues. Provide feedback to the operations team to improve service quality and customer satisfaction. Negotiation and Contract Management: Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with clients to ensure profitable deals. Prepare and review contracts and agreements to ensure compliance with company policies and industry regulations. Manage contract renewals and amendments as needed. Sales Reporting and Documentation: Maintain accurate records of sales activities, client interactions, and contract details. Prepare regular sales reports and forecasts for senior management. Use CRM software to track sales leads, opportunities, and customer interactions. Customer Service: Address and resolve client inquiries and complaints in a timely and professional manner. Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction through effective communication and service delivery. Provide ongoing support to clients to ensure their logistics needs are met. Strong knowledge of freight forwarding processes, domestic logistics, and industry regulations. Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. Ability to build and maintain strong client relationships. Proficient in CRM software and Microsoft Office Suite. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Self-motivated and results-oriented with the ability to work independently. Key Competencies: Sales and negotiation skills Customer relationship management Strategic thinking and market analysis Strong communication and presentation skills Ability to work under pressure and meet sales targets Team collaboration and coordination Working Conditions: Office environment with frequent travel to client sites and industry events. Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends, as needed.

column2: We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a    TTL Specialist / Manager          The   TTL Specialist / Manager    will be responsible for overseeing and coordinating all aspects of logistics operations, including transportation, classification, record keeping and other trade compliance related matters      The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, strong problem-solving abilities, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer service primarily for TTL related topics in Area South Asia (India, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, etc) and other allocated countries in future      This role is pivotal in ensuring that our transportation and logistics activities comply with international trade regulations and company policies      The ideal candidate will have a strong background in customs regulations, import/export processes, International Taxation and supply chain logistics                     Your Responsibilities            Support allocated local divisions/Area with Transportation, Trade Compliance & Logistics (TT&L) issues on day-to-day basis e.g.          Goods tariffing, origin,          Free trade agreements,          Export control,          Customs documents,          Interface with customs authorities,          Logistics- all modes            Develop and implement trade compliance strategies to ensure adherence to import/export regulations. Stay updated on changes in trade regulations and communicate updates to relevant stakeholders. Your Background          Bachelor s Degree or Masters in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, International Business, or a related field preferred. Local Purchase Instrument and Stores:         Check the Purchase requisition system through Focus (ERP System).     As per the requisition, will take a quote from at least three vendors. One from the regular vendor and others from the market.     End-to-end communication and coordination with vendors and stores.     Negotiate with the vendor for technical (User Requirements) & pricing parameters.     Negotiate with the vendors for payment terms for better cash flow.     Follow up with the transporter for delivery at the warehouse or customer place.         2. Fixed Assets Purchase:         Check the proper approval of requestion by the authority.     After requisition is received start finding the vendor from the local area.     As per the requisition, will take a quote from at least three vendors.     Apart from the price, check warranty terms, service terms, and payment terms.     Making product-wise comparison sheet.     Negotiation of payment and delivery Terms.     Co-ordinate Accounts for proper booking in Assets.         3. Import purchase spares:         Run the requisition from Focus.     Accordingly, make the PO as per the format defined by the suppliers.     Same PO update in the Focus.     Continue to update the status of readiness of the product to stores     After the readiness of the packing, start coordinating with the freight forwarder.     Negotiate the rate with F&F     Check documents as per the PO or not.     AWB/BOL, invoice, and packing list need to be forwarded to the clearing agent and our internal clearing person.     Documents forwarded to Accounts for payment         4. Common Point of Activity:          Before introducing the new vendor, need to check the parameters with the technical person.     The purchase officer will coordinate with the Accounts team and solve the following issues.         PO should linked properly with Expense vouchers or GRN.     Pending PO vs Invoice received.     Bill received it on time when payment was made in advance.     Any purchase made against special approval should be forwarded to the accounts approval email along with the invoice.     Ensure proper booking of expenses or purchases in Focus.     Purchase Invoice should be the same as per our PO.     Ensure Purchase invoiced as per GST rules so at to obtain GST credit in a proper way.     and provide training from time to time to purchase requisition sender as needed to enhance procurement practices.     Coordinate with the vendor after payment and share the payment advice along with invoice details with them.Any shortfall is communicated to local suppliers and exporters.         Key Success Behaviours (Key Competencies):         Well versed and Experienced in End to End procurement, purchasing, or supply chain management and processes.     Knowledge of Import Export procedure.     Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.     Experience in handling procurement software.     Excellent organizational and time management abilities.     Ability to work well under pressure and meet tight deadlines.     Knowledge of relevant laws and regulations governing procurement activities.

column2: Job Description  About Position: -  Position: "Trade & Custom Analyst" Experience: 1 - 3 yrs.  Location: Bangalore  Job Description  Responsible for classifying commodities, software, and technology with Harmonized Tariff System Numbers (HTS) for US,EU and AP Countries.  Responsible for classifying commodities, software, and technology with Export Control Classification Numbers (ECCN) according to the Bureau of Industry and Security Commerce Control List (CCL) and other EU and AP country laws and regulations.  Interface with relevant vendor engineering design  / Product Management / Sales / Procurement team to determine and validate product classification.  Respond and maintain classification data in the SAP - GTS, and complete classifications assigned within the defined turnaround time.  Ensure data integrity related to classification and value information declared to Customs authorities.  Responsible for ensuring legal compliance within government rules and regulations pertaining to classification  Ability to research discrepancies and provide substantiation to support classification claims to Customs In a timely manner.  Establish and maintain a central database of global Harmonized Tariff Schedules (HTS), Export Control Classification Numbers (ECCN) and duty / tax rates for all products.  Support implementation of approved internal trade projects related to classification and other import and export area.  Submit binding rulings when necessary and applicable  Support denied party screening, Country of Origin and Free Trade Agreement related projects. Eligibility Criteria:  1 Years Experience in trade and customs areas specific to HTS / ECCN classification.  Degree in business, finance or related engineering field. Engineering Graduates or Graduates with customs background preferred  Familiarity with Export Administration Regulations and those of U.S. Customs and Border Protection as well as the Customs regulations for the AP,US,EU Region will be an added advantage  Knowledgeable with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.}, and SAP Personal Trait Profile:  Self - starter minimal supervision required  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Excellent oral and written communication skills .Cross - cultural communication skill desired  Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail  Must be able to work with R&D, procurement, Product Management & Logistics group Interested candidates can send your updated profile with below mentioned details.
