column2: Job title: Team Lead Procurement Compliance  Job Location: Bangalore  Job Description  Conflict Minerals:  1) Lead and manage Company s Conflict Minerals compliance program  2) Act as the primary liaison with external customers and suppliers on a global basis, ensuring meeting customers requirements regarding Conflict Minerals compliance and related issues  3) Interface with all necessary functional teams to facilitate Company s Conflict Minerals compliance program 4) Keep abreast of applicable EICC CFSI compliance policies, requirements, laws, and regulations and effectively monitor the trends for Conflict Minerals strategies 5) Provide timely Conflict Minerals updates to internal teams and customers as needed 6) Maintain a continuous improvement mind set to take initiative and seek out innovative solutions 7) Meet commitments and schedules for CMRT deliverables to drive a customer focus 8) Support our sourcing operations with new supplier qualification and on-boarding initiatives, corrective actions, and supplier continuous monitoring and improvements Team/People Management:  1) Manage a global Conflict Minerals team of four in various regions of the globe (two in Bangalore, India and two in Shanghai, China); oversee their workload and keep individual contributors on task and assign tasks appropriately 2) Demonstrate profession and team-oriented approach to work, leveraging MBM guiding principles 3) Responsible for the selection, development, and retention of the Conflict Minerals team members 4) Mentor, coach, and counsel direct reports to be accountable to performance expectations 5) Create an inclusive, positive work environment; encourage diversity of thought and innovation 6) Recognize and reward talent and accomplishments 7) Ability to provide positive direction and drive high standards of quality and performance 8) Ability to step in and roll up sleeves to perform non-routine tasks Process Management:  1) Ability to apply the LEAN concept to drive continuous improvement of the Conflict Minerals program 2) Ability to handle multi tasks and projects successfully 3) Effectively use systems (PSN, EHSM, SAP BW) and other tools for facilitating Conflict Minerals reporting Primary Purpose  A valued team member to our Global Procurement Compliance team focused on satisfying customer needs primarily related to Conflict Minerals through leading and managing the Company s Conflict Minerals compliance program. This person is part of a global team servicing customers Conflict Minerals compliance needs, which requires customer satisfaction and business etiquette. Education  Bachelor s degree in Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or related experience Work Experience  Required  Three (3 ) years of experience working in Corporate Social Responsibility and Conflict Minerals compliance function in a leadership role Direct experience working at large global electronics manufacturing company Must work well in international teams with members from a wide array of functional backgrounds Time zone flexibility with the ability to conduct meetings, outside of the normal business hours, with internal and external stakeholders on a global basis Strong organization skills, ability to prioritize, juggle and execute tasks on strict deadlines Ability to work well in a collaborative and creative environment with little supervision Highly self-motivated and directed with demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, team oriented, and collaborative environment Highly dependable with a strong work ethic Ability to compile data, reports, analyse and present information in a professional format Strong analytical abilities, focused on research, compilation, and interpretation of data Demonstrated experience effectively collaborating with business partners across multiple departments and all levels within the organization Keen attention to detail and demonstrated customer-service focus Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills Adaptable and flexible to change, new ideas, and innovative approaches Ability to maintain positive and effective working relationships with management and co-workers Proficient use of MS Office programs, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook  Experience working on teams with business, suppliers, and customers Preferred  Management experience strongly preferred, or, at a minimum, a demonstrated aptitude for a leadership and people management role Experience working with product lifecycle management software strongly preferred Good skills in SAP and material knowledge specific to Conflict Minerals or product compliance requirements Skills and Abilities:  Required  Communication Skills: Excellent English language skills in speech and writing; ability to speak persuasively in front of a large audience Multi-tasking Skills: Strong ability to work with multi tasks and deliver the right approach for good results Critical Thinking Skills: Strong ability to listen, understand the nature of the communication from the stakeholders and take appropriate actions Flexibility: Ability to be more flexible with work timing Ability to grasp business problems, goals, objectives, and provide alternative solutions Good interpersonal skills to work effectively with different teams within the organization to achieve common goals and respond positively to opportunities Preferred Knowledge of Six Sigma  Knowledge of product compliance Proven analytical skills that demonstrate the ability to complete assignments in a systematic and timely basis If interested please send your UPDATED Profile with below mentioned details. column2: The Warehouse Executive will be responsible for overseeing and managing all warehouse operations, including receiving, storing, picking, packing, and shipping of merchandise.                          The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, excellent organizational abilities, and a commitment to maintaining a safe and efficient work environment.                            Key Responsibilities:                            Manage day-to-day warehouse operations, ensuring efficient utilization of space and resources.                              Supervise warehouse staff, including hiring, training, scheduling, and performance management.                              Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to optimize workflow and productivity.                              Coordinate with other departments, such as logistics, purchasing, and customer service, to ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment.                              Monitor inventory levels and conduct regular inventory audits to maintain accuracy and minimize discrepancies.                              Implement safety protocols and ensure compliance with all health and safety regulations.                              Utilize warehouse management systems (WMS) to track inventory movements and generate reports.                              Identify areas for process improvement and implement solutions to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.                              Resolve any issues or discrepancies related to orders, shipments, or inventory levels.                              Maintain a clean and organized warehouse environment, adhering to company standards and guidelines.                            Qualifications:                            Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field (preferred).                              Proven experience in warehouse management or a similar role, with at least 1-2 years of experience.                              Strong leadership and supervisory skills, with the ability to motivate and manage a team effectively.                              Excellent organizational and time management abilities, with a keen attention to detail.                              Proficiency in warehouse management software and systems, such as WMS and ERP systems.                              Knowledge of health and safety regulations and experience implementing safety protocols.                              Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.                              Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.                              Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to addressing issues.                              Candidate who has worked on SAP is preferred. column2: We are seeking a motivated and organized individual to join our team as a Stores Incharge      The Stores Incharge will play a crucial role in ensuring the efficient management and operation of our institutions stores, contributing to the seamless flow of resources that support our educational initiatives      This role requires a dedicated individual who can uphold our vision and mission through effective inventory management, procurement, and collaboration with various departments                          Responsibilities:              Inventory Management:    Maintain accurate records of all inventory items, monitor stock levels, and implement efficient inventory control practices to prevent stockouts and excesses.              Procurement:    Collaborate with relevant departments to identify their procurement needs, source suppliers, negotiate contracts, and ensure timely procurement of goods while adhering to budget constraints.            Supplier Relations:    Establish and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, ensuring timely delivery of goods, quality control, and adherence to our institutions standards.            Logistics Coordination:    Oversee the receipt, storage, and distribution of materials, supplies, and equipment to various departments within the institution.            Documentation:    Keep meticulous records of all inventory transactions, maintain databases, and generate reports to provide insights into stock levels, consumption patterns, and procurement trends.            Team Collaboration:    Work closely with academic and administrative departments to understand their requirements, anticipate needs, and provide effective solutions to meet their resource demands.            Budget Management:    Assist in the preparation and monitoring of the stores budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and adherence to financial guidelines.            Continuous Improvement:    Stay updated with industry trends, explore innovative inventory management practices, and recommend process improvements to enhance the efficiency of the stores operations.                Qualifications and Requirements:                Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, or a related field. A relevant masters degree is a plus.            Proven experience (3-5 years) in inventory management, procurement, or related fields, preferably within an educational or similar institution.          Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to make data-driven decisions.          Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure accurate record-keeping and inventory control.          Proficiency in using inventory management software and Microsoft Office Suite.          Effective communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with diverse teams and external partners.          Demonstrated ability to negotiate contracts, manage supplier relationships, and optimize procurement processes.          Familiarity with budget management and financial principles.          Ability to align with the institutions vision and mission, displaying a commitment to promoting innovative solutions and dynamic leadership.
